Protest rally held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Protest rally held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The all-people measure committee for Sin Hyo Sun and Sim Mi Son, schoolgirls, killed by U.S. armored car reportedly held a rally on Oct. 9 to protest against the crooked investigation into GIs' violence upon an ex-assemblyman and the crackdown upon the committee.
 The ralliers expressed anger at the fact that bowing to the U.S. Forces' pressure, the police issued warrants of arrest and summons against members of the committee and even walked away a guiltless student.    
 They urged a halt to the wrong investigation into the violence upon an "ex-assemblyman" and the crackdown upon members of the committee, the release of student song tae won and the punishment of GI killers.

articles.title: Ugandan President supports Korean reunification
articles.content:
Ugandan President supports Korean reunification 
    Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- I hope for earlier reunification of Korea, said Ugandan President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni when meeting with DPRK Ambassador to his country Kim Pong Gi on Oct. 10.
 In his lifetime President Kim Il Sung gave assistance to Uganda on many occasions and Kim Jong Il has paid deep attention to the development of friendly relations between the two countries, Museveni noted, expressing profound gratitude for it.    
 Saying that Uganda values the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK, he affirmed his will to strive to expand the economic and technological cooperation between the two countries on the principle of South-South Cooperation.
